message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.NE, cs.CV, cs.DS 

The paper deals with improving the performance of machine learning algorithms, specifically naive Bayes for regression, through the use of optimised artificial surrogate data. This falls under the broad category of machine learning (cs.LG) and artificial intelligence (cs.AI). The use of population-based optimisation algorithms also suggests a connection to neural networks and evolutionary algorithms (cs.NE). The application of the method to image data (as mentioned in the abstract) suggests a connection to computer vision (cs.CV). Finally, the use of training data and the focus on accuracy suggests a connection to data science (cs.DS).
